snippet: For frustrated conservative voters, the end of the government shutdown was as much a surrender to reality as to Democratic demands.
abstract: Conservative voters see reopening of government without defunding of health care law as a surrender to reality as much as to Democratic demands;  many conservatives describe a dispiriting gap between conservative ideals, which they believe inspire widespread agreement, and conservative tactics, which do not; failure to stop health care plan has left some Republicans pessimistic and disillusioned.

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Athens, Tenn.; Dan Frosch from Colorado Springs; and Jon Hurdle from Doylestown, Pa.

lead_paragraph: For frustrated conservative voters, the end of the government shutdown was as much a surrender to reality as to Democratic demands.

headline.main: From the Right, Despair, Anger and Disillusion
headline.print_headline: From the Right, Despair, Anger And Disillusion

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
